title.narrative: 4.2. STRENGTHENED CHILD PROTECTION AND JUSTICE SYSTEMS

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF LABOUR AND SOCIAL RESEARCH

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

related-activity.ref: 0260/A0/06/884 4. CHILD RIGHTS SYSTEMS AND CHILD PROTECTION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: Despite the challenges caused by the impact of the ongoing double emergency, UNICEF continued to strengthen the capacities of the social service workforce professionals, judges, prosecutors, investigators and police to protect children at risk or victims of violence. UNICEF’s advocacy and support resulted in the adoption of secondary legislation to start implementing forensic interviewing for child victims and preparing a pool of certified forensic interviewers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems, Text

baseline.value: Justice professionals in criminal justice trained on working with child offenders. Procedures are not child friendly. No multi-disciplinary approach in place.

target.value: 2025:Justice professionals trained and certified in working with child victims and witnesses, as well as children in civil proceedings. Criminal justice processes aligned with child-friendly justice standards.

actual.value: 2021:Special curricula for forensic interviewer psychologists developed and piloted (1st cohort of 25 psychologists trained and certified)

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems, Text

baseline.value: Justice professionals in criminal justice trained on working with child offenders. Procedures are not child friendly. No multi-disciplinary approach in place.

title.narrative: Level of development of child protection system with clearly defined roles and responsibilities., Text

baseline.value: Roles and responsibilities within and between the child protection and justice systems are fragmented and not clear, capacities are lacking.

target.value: 2025:Child protection and justice systems operational and capable to prevent separation of children from families and violence against children

actual.value: 2021:Conceptual division of roles between the community and regional levels agreed and reflected in draft laws (e.g. draft amendments to the Family Code) and secondary legislation

title.narrative: Level of development of child protection system with clearly defined roles and responsibilities., Text

baseline.value: Roles and responsibilities within and between the child protection and justice systems are fragmented and not clear, capacities are lacking.

target.value: 2025:Child protection and justice systems operational and capable to prevent separation of children from families and violence against children

actual.value: 2021:Conceptual division of roles between the community and regional levels agreed and reflected in draft laws (e.g. draft amendments to the Family Code) and secondary legislation
